page.title: 17OWLETT HALL
page.content: {Owlett Hall}is to be found near{West {Hardwick,}a{small village}set amongst arable and pasture land. Owlett Hall is a small but attractive{stone built {farmhouse.}We found that it was{built {in 1851}from the{inscription in Roman {numerals (MDCCCL1)}which is carved under the eaves. Owlett Hall is used entirely for{pig {farming}over 16 acres. The farm has over 200 sows, 50 boars and approximately 1000 piglets. The pigs are{sold}to anyone who wishes to buy them. {The present owners}of the hall have been there for just over 1 year. They like West Hardwick, finding it a peacful and friendly place to live.
